hypothesis_content.title: Volatility Compression Breakout in Neutral Regime
hypothesis_content.statement: When BTC's 10-day realized volatility falls below its 30-day average while the market is in NEUTRAL regime, and BTC price is trading within ±3% of its 20-day moving average, a breakout above the 20-day high will lead to a mean-reverting volatility expansion with positive returns over the next 5 days.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Neutral regimes often feature volatility compression before directional moves. Low realized volatility relative to recent history suggests suppressed price action. Breakout from compression near moving average indicates potential momentum shift while maintaining regime context.
entry_conditions: BTC 10-day realized volatility < BTC 30-day realized volatility

exit_conditions.take_profit: 5-day return reaches +4% OR 10-day realized volatility exceeds 30-day by 15%

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Breakout fails to sustain (closes back inside range within 2 days) OR volatility remains compressed despite breakout (10-day RV stays below 30-day after 5 days).
